snippet: Scientists said the deadly Arizona blaze and 15 others that remained uncontained from New Mexico to California were part of a warmer trend in the West that would bring more catastrophic fires.
abstract: Scientists say Arizona wildfire and 15 others that remain uncontained from New Mexico to California are part of a warmer trend in the West that will bring more catastrophic fires.

byline.original: By FELICITY BARRINGER and KENNETH CHANG
byline.contributor: Fernanda Santos and John Dougherty contributed reporting from Prescott, Ariz., and Jonathan Weisman from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Scientists said the deadly Arizona blaze and 15 others that remained uncontained from New Mexico to California were part of a warmer trend in the West that would bring more catastrophic fires.

headline.main: Experts See New Normal as a Hotter, Drier West Faces More Huge Fires
headline.print_headline: Experts See New Normal As a Hotter, Drier West Faces More Huge Fires
